name: David Sinclair Longevity Protocol
description: Protocol based on research by Harvard geneticist David Sinclair (author of "Lifespan"). Centers on the Information Theory of Aging — epigenetic noise accumulation. Core stack: NMN, resveratrol, metformin, with intermittent fasting and cold/heat exposure.

dosage.range: Variable — he adjusts based on bloodwork
dosage.notes: Sinclair has publicly shared his personal protocol. Resveratrol with fat source in morning. NMN morning. Metformin evening (skip on exercise days). Plus vitamin D, K2, aspirin, TMG.

keyFindings: Sinclair lab: NMN restored NAD+ levels and improved healthspan in aged mice
ICE mice: epigenetic reprogramming reversed aging (Sinclair lab, Cell 2023)
Controversial — some peers dispute extrapolation from mouse to human data
interactions: Complex multi-drug protocol — interaction mapping important
